title: Analyta semantris
text:
Analyta semantris is a <a href="moth">moth</a> in the family <a href="Crambidae">Crambidae</a>. It was described by <a href="Harrison%20Gray%20Dyar%20Jr.">Harrison Gray Dyar Jr.</a> in 1914. It is found in <a href="Panama">Panama</a> and <a href="French%20Guiana">French Guiana</a>.
The <a href="wingspan">wingspan</a> is about 17 mm. There is an irregularly triangular yellow patch on the forewings near the middle of the inner margin. The costa is blackish purple, the outer area suffused with red brown. The costal edge is red brown, followed by a purple band. The hindwings are white, shaded by yellow at the base, apex and the costal mark.
